lead_paragraph: The continuing drought in California cost the state at least $1 billion last year in agriculture losses, increases in energy costs and damage to the environment, state officials say. Losses to agriculture, estimated at $455 million in 1990, were about $500 million last year, according to a report released on Thursday by the State Department of Water Resources.
